title: What's The Return on Meow Wolf's House of Eternal Return? (2020)
preview: Brief commentary on outsider art and business models
body:
_I originally wrote this piece for_ _[my print magazine](https://thenewmodality.com/)_ _in 2020. The version below has been slightly edited to be up-to-date, and it includes a few additional details._

—

Over in Santa Fe, the “[House of Eternal Return](https://meowwolf.com/visit/santa-fe/about)” — a kind of psychedelic Disneyland, created by the art collective Meow Wolf — has become famous among weirdos. Indie travel site _Atlas Obscura_ [says](https://www.atlasobscura.com/places/house-of-eternal-return) it’s “an immersive environment that is part haunted house, part choose-your-own-adventure, and part jungle gym.”

[![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!AHAP!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F5a75e35f-378c-45e3-ad1f-c28f80559417_2100x2100.png)](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!AHAP!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F5a75e35f-378c-45e3-ad1f-c28f80559417_2100x2100.png)

{{caption:This photo of the House of Eternal Return’s upstairs toilet was donated to my magazine by photographer Jane Hu, who does a lot of neat counterculture photography. Find her at @plainjane on Instagram.}}

I’ll have you know that I insisted on visiting the House of Eternal Return right when it opened, in 2016, at which point I Instagrammed their [waivers for dimension-jumping](https://www.instagram.com/p/BHyFNr6DrSM/). Here’s an excerpt:

> **Liability Waiver Form Required for Entrance to Portals Bermuda:
> The Multiverse’s Premiere Resort for the Spiritually Aware**
>
> The risk of injury or death at Portals Bermuda is significant, including but not limited to:
>
> * **Permanent** spatial/temporal displacement due to wormhole malfunctions
>
> * **Disappearance** by an interdimensional police organization (a.k.a. “The Charter”), the agents of which may or may not have infiltrated Portals Bermuda
>
> * **Centipede** attacks in the swamps of the Carboniferous Forest
>
> * \[[etc](https://www.instagram.com/p/BHyFNr6DrSM/).]

The House of Eternal Return is reportedly the most Instagrammed place in New Mexico, [surpassing even](https://www.krqe.com/news/news-briefs/meow-wolf-surpasses-balloon-fiesta-as-most-instagrammed-place-in-new-mexico/1009375112) the yearly Balloon Festival, and I am probably the only person left in the journalism industry willing to make on-the-record statements like “I love Instagram.”

Much of the serious art world curls its lip at “Instagram museums.” To be fair, many non-Meow Wolf examples are rather shallow. In a 2018 _New York Times_ article titled “[The Existential Void of the Pop-Up ‘Experience,’](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/26/arts/color-factory-museum-of-ice-cream-rose-mansion-29rooms-candytopia.html)” the always-entertaining Amanda Hess reports on New York City spaces like the Rosé Mansion, Color Factory, Candytopia, and the Museum of Ice Cream: “I went to as many Instagrammable ‘museums,’ ‘factories,’ and ‘mansions’ as I could,” she writes. “They nearly broke me… It was as if I was witnessing the total erosion of meaning itself.”

Hess is a pop culture critic, and her article is gentle compared to those by fine art critics. Attacking the Museum of Ice Cream [in the online journal](https://news.artnet.com/opinion/gray-market-museum-ice-cream-1634467) _[artnet](https://news.artnet.com/opinion/gray-market-museum-ice-cream-1634467)_ _(artnet’s_ name is lowercase on purpose), Tim Schneider uses words like “decry,” “disgust,” and “outrageous,” and notes that “I might rather live under a bridge for the rest of this year than experience \[the MOIC] in person.”

The source of his rage becomes clear as Schneider explores the MOIC’s business model: It’s “depressingly sustainable compared to legitimate art museums and galleries,” he says.

[Read more](https://lydialaurenson.substack.com/p/whats-the-return-on-meow-wolfs-house)

***

Thank you for reading Solar Light. [If you'd like to subscribe on Substack, you can find](https://lydialaurenson.substack.com/about) *[Solar Light](https://lydialaurenson.substack.com/about)* [there.](https://lydialaurenson.substack.com/about) I can also be found elsewhere on the internet as Lydia Laurenson :)
